means: （使船）翻，倾覆( capsize的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: The lifeboat capsized, throwing the occupants into the water.
sentence.Network_cn: 救生艇倾覆，艇里的人被掀入水中。

sentence.Network_en: Forty-eight people have drowned after their boat capsized during a storm.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们的船在暴风雨中倾覆后有48人溺亡。

sentence.Network_en: Their boat had capsized in midstream.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们的船在河中央翻了。

PerfectNetExp.abs: How many drowned when the boat capsized ?, 当船倾覆时有多少人淹死了?

list.abs: capsized position 倾覆位置capsizing case 倾覆事故-
capsizing moment windlass 立式锚机capsizing moment 倾覆力矩capsizing 倾覆
2. capsizing anglecapsized position 倾覆位置capsizing case 倾覆事故
capsizing case 倾覆事故capsizing lever 倾覆力臂capsizing moment bar shoe 绞盘棒插座

entry.def: If you capsize a boat or if it capsizes, it turns upside down in the water.

example.ex: The sea got very rough and the boat capsized...
example.tran: 海上波涛汹涌,小船翻了。

example.ex: I didn't count on his capsizing the raft.
example.tran: 我没有想到他会把筏子弄翻。

auth_sentence.content: "They ran into some bad weather, capsized, the boat sank, " Dunphy said.
auth_sentence.res_content: "They ran into some bad weather, capsized, the boat sank, " Dunphy said.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: "They ran into some bad weather, capsized, the boat sank, " Dunphy said.

auth_sentence.content: The casualty was "seriously ill" after being trapped under his capsized Sailability Hawk dinghy for five minutes.
auth_sentence.res_content: The casualty was "seriously ill" after being trapped under his capsized Sailability Hawk dinghy for five minutes.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The casualty was "seriously ill" after being trapped under his capsized Sailability Hawk dinghy for five minutes.

auth_sentence.content: He then capsized the boat while trying to crawl back on board, said deputies.
auth_sentence.res_content: He then capsized the boat while trying to crawl back on board, said deputies.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He then capsized the boat while trying to crawl back on board, said deputies.
